protein.general_function: Involved in transferase activity, transferring pentosyl groups
protein.specific_function: Catalyzes the reversible phosphorylytic cleavage of uridine and deoxyuridine to uracil and ribose- or deoxyribose-1-phosphate. The produced molecules are then utilized as carbon and energy sources or in the rescue of pyrimidine bases for nucleotide synthesis. Shows substrate specificity and accept uridine, deoxyuridine, and thymidine as well as the two pyrimidine nucleoside analogs 5-fluorouridine and 5-fluoro-2(')-deoxyuridine as substrates.

go_class.description: nucleobase, nucleoside, nucleotide and nucleic acid metabolic process
nucleobase, nucleoside and nucleotide metabolic process

reference.reference_text: Johansson M: Identification of a novel human uridine phosphorylase. Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2003 Jul 18;307(1):41-6.
